TopicTitle: Best/Worst bug ever. Just want to share the fun.

Articles.Content:
So I had a station in orbit with Jeb on it, so aromaticity Jeb did something, and when I went to it from map it exploded shock I thought some structural weirdness had happened. But then I look around and I find more command pods, four of them in total, all with Jeb in. So A this point you can guess that the station duplicated it's self and then promptly collided with it's self. But wait two of the capsules where no were near the over two but where on there own at vastly different points of the orbit on there own, with no change in the orbit.

Now I don't know if this is a Bug in the Base game as I have three mods installed. one being an alpha. But that's it hope you like it.
It's a commonly known bug. I thought they had fixed it, but I guess not. Sorry to hear that though. Do you have any quicksaves?
I had just loaded the game so I did not have any quicksaves, much to my disappointment. but on the plus side I have lots of Jebs now. :-D

A few Jebs in alternate dimensions slipped through into your KSP dimension is all...

Meanwhile.... this bug is really annoying and one of the reasons why I tend to save every few minutes and after every major event. The duplicates could be down to a symmetry bug that keeps appearing. I've never had multiple command pods though... Had numerous booster segment though.

I had just loaded the game so I did not have any quicksaves, much to my disappointment. but on the plus side I have lots of Jebs now. :-D

I found out that when my Mun base randomly exploded that quicksaves are kept and not wiped once the game has been exited like other games go. I had quit out of frustration and checked my save file for multiple saves being the first time hoping that I could recover an older save. Fortunately my quick save was from a short time before explosion and once I rebooted the game f9 went right to it.

I found an crack in Bop surface I could see Jool trough.

More images and info

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/48461-Grand-tour-4-new-attempt-at-an-below-100-ton-grand-tour?p=638185&viewfull=1#post638185

I found out that when my Mun base randomly exploded that quicksaves are kept and not wiped once the game has been exited like other games go. I had quit out of frustration and checked my save file for multiple saves being the first time hoping that I could recover an older save. Fortunately my quick save was from a short time before explosion and once I rebooted the game f9 went right to it.

I will have to keep that in made and save more often like NeoMorph said as when I pressed F9 I got nothing not one save, I feel ashamed in my self, I I normally save often in over games I have backups, but I don't on this one. Sad Face.
